intro: Panargyrum, commonly known as the silverleaf plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically pale green or yellow. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture. Panargyrum is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often grown as an ornamental plant for its unique appearance.
